tool.name: Histogram w ggplot2
tool.command:
Rscript '$__tool_directory__'/ggplotscripthistogram.R --input '$input1' --title '$title' --xlab '$xlab' --ylab '$ylab' --transform '$transform' --scaling '$scaling.Plot_scaling' --density '$density' --colorscheme '$coloring.colorscheme' --dim '$dimensions.plotdim' --facet '$facet' --size '$size' --binwidth '$binwidth' --legend '$legend' --output 'Rplot.pdf' #if str( $coloring.colorscheme ) == 'Defined': --colors '${coloring.colors}' --colororder '${coloring.colororder}' #else: --colors irrelevant --colororder 1 #end if
#if str( $scaling.Plot_scaling ) == "Defined": --xaxismin '${scaling.xaxismin}' --xaxismax '${scaling.xaxismax}' --yaxismin '${scaling.yaxismin}' --yaxismax '${scaling.yaxismax}' #else: --xaxismin 0 --xaxismax 1 --yaxismin 2 --yaxismax 3 #end if
#if str( $dimensions.plotdim ) == "Defined": --woutputdim '${dimensions.woutputdim}' --houtputdim '${dimensions.houtputdim}' #else: --woutputdim 7 --houtputdim 7 #end if

param.name: input1
param.label: Input should have column headers - these will be the columns that are plotted

param.name: transform
param.label: Advanced - log transformation
param.option: Plot the data as it is
Log2(value) transform my data
Log2(value+1) transform my data
Log10(value) transform my data
Log10(value+1) transform my data

param.name: density
param.label: Advanced - plot counts or density
param.option: Plot counts on the y-axis
Plot frequency on the y-axis
Plot normalized frequency on the y-axis

param.name: facet
param.label: Advanced - faceting
param.option: Plot my groups on one plot
Plot my groups on individual plots

param.name: colorscheme
param.label: Advanced - coloring groups
param.option: No thanks - just use the default scheme to color code my groups (columns)
I want to use defined color palettes to differentiate my groups (columns)

param.name: colors
param.label: Color schemes to differentiate your groups
param.option: Default color scheme

Red to purple (discrete, max=9 colors)
Shades of purple from light to dark (discrete, max=9 colors)
Purple to red (discrete, max=9 colors)
Purple to blue to green (discrete, max=9 colors)
Purple to blue(discrete, max=9 colors)
Orange to red (discrete, max=9 colors)
Shades of orange from light to dark (discrete, max=9 colors)
Shades of grey from light to dark (discrete, max=9 colors)
Shades of greens from light to dark (discrete, max=9 colors)

param.option: Default order of color scheme

param.option: Automatic axis scaling
User deined axis scales

param.option: Default

param.label: Legend options
param.option: Include legend on plot
Hide legend

tool.help:
This tool will generate a histogram representing the distrinutions of each numerical column. Each column should have a descriptive header with no spaces, which will be used in the plot legend to represent the corresponding column (group).
Input data example: ID Cond_A Cond_B gene_A 10 15 gene_B 8 12 gene_C 10 15 gene_D 6 9 gene_E 9 13.5 gene_F 8 12
